result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Advised of rights to an attorney.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing. State requests $1000 Cash bond. 9 open cases.  Atty. Hayes requests $100 cash.  $1000.00 CASH bond set.
Arraignment scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

2:45 PM Prosecuting attorney C. Remington McConnell in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Patricia Anne Smekofske appeared by video, in custody and w/Atty Annie Getsinger.  Court states cases and appearances. 
 Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  DE hasn't applied for PD yet but does have Atty Duren in other matters so he will likely request he be appointed in this matter as well.  Court finds probable cause.  Advised of right to counsel.  State requests $300 cash bond w/conditions noting warrant history.  Atty Getsinger responds requesting signature bond.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.  22TR3546 to track.  $1,000.00 signature bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Absolute sobriety.  Not to possess alcohol or any controlled substances w/o a valid prescription.  If a prescription is received the DE must maintain it in it's original bottle showing the DE's name, the name of the substance and the name of the doctor who prescribed it.
